column4: ok my swap partition works if that cat /proc/swaps is accurate
then i have no clue why i cannot wake up from suspend
yep
/dev/sda6 listed being 1024mb
Any hints how i can track the problem down of suspend not working properly?
ramirand - 512mb ram and 1GB for the swap
it is an old laptop... but ubuntu makes it fly still compared to winxp
actually i tried only suspend, trying hibernation now
suspend it would go to sleep mode, but waking up fails
on a notebook suspend is quite essential
old laptop might not have acpi, but apm or something instead
never tried it myself tough
- its not that old :D appart it works perfectly fine in windowsXP
I can hibernate even my p4 desktop
first you should try without fancy graphics drivers I guess
- it is still a nc8000 hp with a pentium m 1.6ghz and a ati 9600 radeon. Its quite fast if the ram is not filled
i tried on a fresh install without any drivers. the original drivers make it fail completely
nice, i think i need a reinstall after this hibernation attempt
have you tried acpi=off or something similar too?
not only suspend does not work, but hibernation got the system stuck at "starting up...." without any disk activity at all
acpi off is quite anti suspend i would think
anyways suspending and hibernating do work for my desk since ibex
for ex they did not work every time before. For ex. I had no sound after resuming
on my notebook it couldnt be worse. i would never have thought a failed hibernation attempt could mark my system unbootable
